meanings.definition: Make a high-pitched sound or cry.
meanings.sent1: The mouse squeaked loudly when it saw the cat.
meanings.sent2: The door squeaked as it opened slowly.
meanings.sent3: The rusty swing set squeaked with each push.
meanings.sent4: The old wooden floorboards squeaked under their weight.
meanings.sent5: The excited puppy squeaked with joy when its owner returned.

meanings.sent1: The rubber duck squeaked when squeezed.
meanings.sent2: The balloon squeaked as it deflated.
meanings.sent3: The toy car squeaked as it rolled across the floor.
meanings.sent4: The rusty gate squeaked in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The excited child squeaked with delight at the surprise.

meanings.sent1: She squeaked through the narrow opening just in time.
meanings.sent2: He squeaked by with a passing grade on the test.
meanings.sent3: The team squeaked out a win in the final seconds.
meanings.sent4: The car barely squeaked past the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The student squeaked through the challenging course with determination.
